title: Boy, 15, fighting for life after falling out the back of a ute before a 16-year-old is arrested
text:
A teenage boy is in a critical condition in hospital after he fell out of a ute that was allegedly being driven by an unlicensed teenager on the Gold Coast.

Emergency services were called to Larne Avenue in Bundall at 1am on Sunday where they found a 15-year-old boy.

He was suffering from severe head injuries and was taken to Gold Coast University Hospital.

Gold Coast Police believe he hit his head on the ground after falling out of the tray of a ute that was being driven by another teenager.

Larne Avenue in Bundall (pictured) where the incident occurred

They believe the boy had been with a group of others when the incident occurred.

A 16-year-old boy from Bundall has been arrested and charged with dangerous operation of a vehicle causing grievous bodily harm and unlicensed driving.

The victim is in a critical condition in hospital.

Police are appealing for any further information from the public to assist in their investigation.
description: A teenage boy is in a critical condition in hospital after he fell out of a ute that was allegedly being driven by an unlicensed teenager on the Gold Coast.
authors: Jackson Barron For Daily Mail Australia
